content.description: Start on pockets right of Finger Twist and climb straight up on blank-ish face.
content.location: Right of crack for Finger Twist

content.description: Route follows the vertical crack on the main face of boulder. It comes in at around V2- if you exclusively use the crack for hands and feet. If you'd prefer to rob yourself of the fun this route has to offer then use the face for feet as needed, though doing so diminishes not only the grade, but the quality of the route as well.
content.location: Follow obvious vertical crack on main face of boulder.

content.description: Start on pockets right of UP! and move up on the blank-ish face to the top.
content.location: Start on pockets on right side of large vertical crack, Up! and lower vertical crack

content.description: This boulder is approximately 100 feet right of the Rusty Ravine (if facing the cliff line). It remains in the shade most of the day (like most areas on the southside) and has mostly flat landing areas. Though covered with a lot of moss, more routes could be developed with a little scrubbing and honeysuckle removal from the top.
